text: is probably the stinkiest yes the most
addictive street food of hanoi cuisine
with overpowering smell the dish could
very well become a challenge for
international visitors but to many
hanoians is a must-have if you want to
have an authentic greenery experience of
vietnamese cuisine let's get cooking
a modern version of bunda mam tom is
served in a bamboo tray full of
different toppings such as green sticky
rice patties grilled intestines crispy
and tangy sausages and boiled pork etc
to make yakum or green sticky rice
patties you will need 50 grams of minced
pork 100 gram of pork paste or yoshum 50
gram of green sticky rice a tablespoon
of cornstarch and 1 egg first combine
the green sticky rice with 2 tbsp of
beaten egg mix well and leave to sit for
about 10 minutes in the last mixing bowl
combine the pork mince pork paste the
green sticky rice and egg mix season
with some stock powder pepper and a
tablespoon of cornstarch and a
tablespoon of minced garlic put on
cloves and mix well when it all comes
together divide and shape into patties
place on a greased plate and refrigerate
for about 1 hour then steam for about 15
minutes so the green sticky rice can
bloom well
then pat dry and pan fry until golden
brown on both sides the patties are
crispy on the outside succulents and
juices on the inside with the glutinous
green sticky rice very fragrant and
delicious you can serve jakkum as a
snack at a days or serve at the topping
on
dom tray
another classic topping for the bunda
mam tom tray is grilled in testing with
the beautiful golden shiny glaze grill
intestine has become one of the favorite
toppings on the bunda mam tom tray it's
very crucial to prepare the small
intestine well before cooking insert a
small piece of ginger and let it run
through the intestine they will push
away all the smelly parts inside repeat
three times then place the intestine in
a bowl add three tablespoons of
all-purpose flour massage for about 3
minutes and then rinse well then wash
the intestine once more time with some
salt and vinegar then rinse a few time
under running water to make sure that
it's all clean and no longer smelly
place a tablespoon of minced garlic and
shallot on the tea glass and squeeze out
the juice combine the intestine with the
garlic and shallot juice a teaspoon of
fish sauce
[Music]
some stock powder one and a half
teaspoon of sugar three tablespoons of
natural oil a teaspoon of satay mix
mix well and leave to marinate for about
30 minutes you can grill the intestine
over charcoal or in an airfryer at 160
degrees celsius for about 10 minutes
brush with some honey to achieve a
golden look then cut into bite size
pieces it's golden shiny crunchy and
slightly chewy it adds a really
interesting texture to your bunda mom
dom set next cut the tofu into about 2
inch cubes pat dry and deep fry until
golden brown on the outside but the
inside is still soft and juicy
boiled pork chopper is another must-have
toppings on the modern bundag mam tom
tray remove the bone from the pork leg
lay out on a flat surface season with
salt and pepper some smash and minced
shallots stock powder then roll it up
and you kitchen try to tie into a log
making sure the pork skin fully covered
the log you can steam or boil the pork
leg with some salt smashed shallots and
sliced onion for about 45 minutes to an
hour depending on the size then transfer
to a bowl of ice cold water leave to
cool completely and chill in the fridge
for a few hours before cutting into thin
slices
one indispensable product of bunda mam
tom is of course the mam tong which is a
fermented shrimp sauce that northern
vietnamese people love so much combine 3
tbsp of the fermented shrimp sauce with
2 tbsp of sugar in a large bowl add some
machi if you like and a tablespoon of
rice wine
stir really well and leave to sit for
about 1 hour for the flavors to develop
next take some oil until smoky and pour
into the surface of the shrimp sauce
when the oil heats the sauce it should
make a sizzling sound when you serve
squeeze in the juice of a few kumquats
then beat well until foamy then add mint
garlic chili and lemongrass mix well cut
cucumber into thick slices
the noodles used in wundak mam thom are
rice vermicelli but pressed into patches
and cut into cubes giving them a harder
and firmer texture now arrange
everything on a bamboo tray add some
lettuce and fresh herbs like perilla
there you have a delicious and abundant
modern set of mam tom such a treat bon
appetit don't forget to like share the
video if you enjoy and subscribe to my
channel for more delicious vietnamese
food see you next time bye
[Music]
